briefdescription.para: SIScalar represents a scalar physical quantity. It is a concrete subtype of SIQuantity. It has three essential attributes: a unit, an elementType, and a numerical value. SIScalar supports four elementTypes: float, double, float complex, and double complex.
This is the type of a reference to immutable SIScalar.
This is the type of a reference to mutable SIScalar.
Returns the type ID for SIScalar.
Creates a copy of a scalar.
Creates a mutable copy of a scalar.

simplesect.para: A mutable copy of the scalar.

briefdescription.para: Creates a scalar from float value and unit.
Creates a mutable scalar from float value and unit.
Creates a scalar from double value and unit.
Creates a mutable scalar from double value and unit.
Creates a scalar from float complex value and unit.
Creates a mutable scalar from float complex value and unit.
Creates a scalar from double complex value and unit.
Creates a mutable scalar from double complex value and unit.
Creates a new SIScalar object from a string containing a single unit name from the unit library.

detaileddescription.para: This function parses the provided OCStringRef, which should contain a single valid unit name (e.g., "m", "kg", "s"). It returns a new immutable SIScalarRef representing the parsed unit with a value of 1.0, or NULL if the string is invalid or the unit is not found.

parameterdescription.para: An OCStringRef containing the name or symbol of a single unit to look up in the unit library.

simplesect.para: A new SIScalarRef representing the unit with value 1.0, or NULL if the string is invalid or the unit is not found.
The caller is responsible for releasing the returned SIScalarRef.
This function does not support parsing compound units or expressions; only single unit names are accepted.

Returns a double value.

Returns the argument value of scalar.
Calculates and returns float value after converting to unit.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to boolean that returns true if operation was successful.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to boolean that returns true if operation was successful.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to boolean that returns true if operation was successful.

briefdescription.para: Calculates and returns double complex value after converting to unit.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to boolean that returns true if operation was successful.

briefdescription.para: Calculates and returns float value after converting to its coherent SI unit.
Calculates and returns double value after converting to its coherent SI unit.
Calculates and returns float complex value after converting to its coherent SI unit.
Calculates and returns double complex value after converting to its coherent SI unit.
Creates a copy of a scalar as elementType.

detaileddescription.para:
theScalar
The scalar.
elementType
The element type.
A copy of the scalar.
Note that down conversion from double to float loses precision and down conversion from complex to real loses the imaginary part of the quantity.

briefdescription.para: Takes the complex number part of a scalar.

detaileddescription.para:
theScalar
The scalar.
part
The complex number part.
True if successful, false otherwise.
Complex number parts are kSIRealPart, kSIImaginaryPart, kSIMagnitudePart, and kSIArgumentPart.

briefdescription.para: Creates a scalar from complex number part.

detaileddescription.para:
theScalar
The scalar.
part
The complex number part.
A SIScalar object.
Complex number parts are kSIRealPart, kSIImaginaryPart, kSIMagnitudePart, and kSIArgumentPart.

briefdescription.para: Determines if the two scalars are equal in every attribute.
Compares two scalars and returns a comparison result.

parameterdescription.para: The first scalar object to compare.
The second scalar object to compare.

simplesect.para: A OCComparisonResult constant that indicates whether number is equal to, less than, or greater than otherNumber. Possible values are kOCCompareLessThan, kOCCompareEqualTo, kOCCompareGreaterThan, or kOCCompareUnequalDimensionalities.

briefdescription.para: Compares two scalars in reduced units and returns a comparison result.

parameterdescription.para: The first scalar object to compare.
The second scalar object to compare.

simplesect.para: A OCComparisonResult constant that indicates whether number is equal to, less than, or greater than otherNumber. Possible values are kOCCompareLessThan, kOCCompareEqualTo, kOCCompareGreaterThan, or kOCCompareUnequalDimensionalities.

briefdescription.para: Compares two scalars loosely and returns a comparison result.

parameterdescription.para: The first scalar object to compare.
The second scalar object to compare.

simplesect.para: A OCComparisonResult constant that indicates whether number is equal to, less than, or greater than otherNumber.

briefdescription.para: Declares the SIScalar interface for representing and manipulating scalar values in the SI system.

detaileddescription.para: SIScalar provides an interface for scalar values, supporting arithmetic operations, type queries, and conversions. The API is CoreFoundation-style, with explicit memory management and reference counting.
SIScalar objects are immutable by default; use SIMutableScalarRef for mutable variants.
This interface supports querying the value, type, and conversions of a scalar, as well as arithmetic and comparison operations.
